Package net.rt5phantom.voidheart

Class AugmentedJavaPlugin

java.lang.Object
org.bukkit.plugin.PluginBase
org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
net.rt5phantom.voidheart.AugmentedJavaPlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor, org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter, org.bukkit.command.TabExecutor, org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin
public abstract class AugmentedJavaPlugin extends org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
An extended version of Spigot's default JavaPlugin class that creates additional methods and variables aimed at making plugin development easier. This augmented version of the Java Plugin class adds the following features; plugin tags, console & player messengers, and debug logging ease of use.
Since:
v1.0.0
Author:
RT5Phantom

  • Field Details

    • PluginTag

      private String PluginTag
      Stores the extending plugin's tag in order to use print it out. The plugin tag can include chat formatting codes signaled by an "&" sign. Please note that the "Â§" sign, unicode character code 'U+00A7', is translated into color codes by default, so it can be used as well. Refer to 'https://minecraft.fandom.com/el/wiki/Formatting_codes' for the full list of chat formatting codes that you can use in Minecraft's chat system.

  • Constructor Details

      public AugmentedJavaPlugin()

  • Method Details

    • getPluginTag

      protected String getPluginTag()
      Gets the extending plugin's tag. This tag is unprocessed and could contain chat codes, if they added by a plugin developer.
      Returns:
      Returns an unprocessed code formatted plugin tag.

    • setPluginTag

      protected void setPluginTag(String PluginTag)
      Sets the extending plugin's tag. This tag can contain chat codes signaled by "&" or "Â§".
      Parameters:
      PluginTag - New version of the plugin tag that will be used to print, which can include chat codes.

    • messageConsoleRaw

      public void messageConsoleRaw(@NotNull String message)
      Sends a message to the console from the plugin, which can include chat formatting codes signaled by an "&" sign without the plugin tag. Please note that the "Â§" sign, unicode character code 'U+00A7', is translated into color codes by default, so it can also be used. Refer to 'https://minecraft.fandom.com/el/wiki/Formatting_codes' for the full list of chat formatting codes that you can use in Minecraft's chat system.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be sent to the console.

      public void messageConsole(@NotNull String message)

Please note that the "Â§" sign, unicode character code 'U+00A7', is translated into color codes by default, so it can also be used. Refer to 'https://minecraft.fandom.com/el/wiki/Formatting_codes' for the full list of chat formatting codes that you can use in Minecraft's chat system.
      Parameters:
